intro: Miconia valtheri var. saldanhaei, commonly known as the Saldaña's miconia, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are often surrounded by prominent bracts. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
